result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek M Augustine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 260 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered payable to Walgreens in the amount of $3,277.80.  To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Criminal Thinking Class.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek M Augustine in court in custody with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties address the PSI and make corrections on the record.  The Defendant's mother addresses the Court. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
Count # 1:
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

7 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 260 days) Sentence to begin forthwith.
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Any term deemed appropriate by agent.
*Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
*Criminal Thinking Class.

RESTITUTION:  $3277.80 payable to Walgreen (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing memorandum filed by defense.
Sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Derek M Augustine in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 of the amended information.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in. The Court orders a presentence investigation report be prepared and filed with the Court no later than January 11, 2016. The Court schedules the matter for a sentencing.   The Court revokes bail. Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
